{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Charter |model=RAX1V1K |revision= |series=AX6000 |fcc_date=06/18/2018 |manuf_country=China |is_manuf=No |manuf=Askey |manuf_model=RT5000W |type=wireless router |fcc_id=H8NRAX1V1K |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=2.5 |pwr_conn=barrel |cpu1_brand=Qualcomm |cpu1_model=IPQ8072;QUALCOMM, IPQ8072, 001, JE7462FF; |cpu1_cspeed=2 GHz |cpu1_cores=4 |fla1_brand=Micron |ram1_brand=Micron |ram1_num=2 |expansion_if_types=USB 3.0, |expansion_usb_num=1 |wi1_chip1_brand=Qualcomm |wi1_chip1_model=QCN5054;Q, QCN5054, 007, FE743RQR; |wi1_802dot11_protocols=an+ac+ax |wi1_ant_conn=U.FL |wi1_txchains=4 |wi1_rxchains=4 |wi1_sstreams=4 |wi2_chip1_brand=Qualcomm |wi2_chip1_model=QCN5024;Q, QCN5024, 007, FE742Q7Y; |wi2_802dot11_protocols=bgn+ax |wi2_ant_conn=U.FL |wi2_txchains=4 |wi2_rxchains=4 |wi2_sstreams=4 |eth_cpu=true |eth_chip2_brand=Aquantia |eth_chip2_model=AQR109;AQuantia, AQrate, AQR109-B0-EG, UAMP34007.S1, 3453C-1805, KOREA; |sw_brand=Qualcomm Atheros |sw_model=QCA8075;Q, QCA8075, 0VV, PU72729C, U072701; |lan_speed=1G |lan_ports=4 |wan_speed=2.5G |wan_ports=1 |addl_chips=Power Management IC;Qualcomm;PMP8074;QUALCOMM, PMP8074, 000-01, PE745VRC;1; ,,, |802dot11_protocols=abgn+ac+ax }}
:• '''4800''' Mbps - 4SS 5GHz [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_802.11ax 802.11ax] (160MHz chan.) :• '''1150''' Mbps - 4SS 2.4GHz [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_802.11ax 802.11ax] (40MHz chan.) = '''''AX6000'' class'''
{{TagLine|802.11ax Dual-Band Dual-Concurrent (DBDC) Wireless Router}} "RT5000W-D187(RoHS) Rev:2.1" is silkscreened on the board in the FCC photos. :This device may also go by the model name of RT5000 (OEM: [[Askey]]). This device will likely be rented by Spectrum (Charter) to their cable :internet customers who pay for Wi-Fi. ===News=== *[https://www.fiercewireless.com/tech/charter-s-cowden-outlines-mso-s-mvno-launch-plans-and-dates-vepc-work-and-cbrs-3-5-ghz-trials ''Charter’s Cowden outlines MSO’s MVNO launch plans and dates,
vEPC work and CBRS 3.5 GHz trials'' on '''FierceWireless'''] (9/14/2017) :“We want to make sure most of that traffic goes over Wi-Fi and not the MVNO,” :Cowden added. “Wi-Fi is an important part of what we do and will continue to be.” :Interestingly, he said Charter is working to deploy 802.11 ac Wave 2 Wi-Fi :technology today, and next year will move to 802.11 ax Wi-Fi technology. ===Forum threads=== *[https://www.snbforums.com/threads/charter-rax1v1k-4x4-802-11ax-wireless-router-w-qualcomm-ipq8072-qcn5024-qcn5054.47396/ ''Charter RAX1V1K - 4x4 802.11ax Wireless Router'' on '''SNB''' forums] ===See also=== :[[List of 802.11ax Hardware]] *[[Charter RAX1V1K]] - [[Askey RT5000W]] - 802.11ax DBDC Router *[[Arris RAC2V1A]] - [[Arris TR4400-AC]] ([[SerComm]]) *[[Askey RAC2V1K]] - [[Askey RT4230W]] ([[Askey]]) *[[Sagemcom RAC2V1S]] - [[Sagemcom F@ST 5280]] *[[Askey RT4220W]] • ''Cube Router'' - 802.11ac 2x2 Router • [http://www.askey.com.tw/wireless10.html PPage] *[[Askey RT4230W]] • ''Puma Router'' - 802.11ac 4x4 Router • [http://www.askey.com.tw/wireless_RT4230W.html PPage] ==Images== Image:H8NRAX1V1K FCC Mainboard.jpg|board top [[Has images::internal| ]] __NOTOC__
